meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being addicted to a particular substance, thing, or activity.
meanings.sent1: Her addiction to chocolate was evident by the empty wrappers scattered around her room.
meanings.sent2: His addiction to video games was affecting his schoolwork.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's addiction to online shopping was getting out of hand, but at least her wardrobe was always up to date.
meanings.sent4: The addiction to social media was like a black hole, sucking away all his free time.
meanings.sent5: The addiction to caffeine was so strong that she couldn't function without her morning coffee.

meanings.definition: A strong and harmful need to regularly have something or do something.
meanings.sent1: His addiction to gambling led to financial ruin.
meanings.sent2: The addiction to smoking was taking a toll on his health.
meanings.sent3: Despite his addiction to sweets, he managed to stay in shape by exercising regularly.
meanings.sent4: The addiction to work consumed all his waking hours, leaving no time for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: Her addiction to adrenaline rushes made her a fearless thrill-seeker.
